document.docAuthor: Zhang, Ruilei, Song, Chao, Qi, Xin & Wang, Xinhua
document.docTitle: Polypedilum (Tripodura) absensilobum Zhang & Wang, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review on the subgenus Tripodura Townes (Diptera: Chironomidae: Polypedilum) from China with eleven new species and a supplementary world checklist

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review on the subgenus Tripodura Townes (Diptera: Chironomidae: Polypedilum) from China with eleven new species and a supplementary world checklist

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 A–D.
Polypedilum ( Tripodura ) absensilobum Zhang & Wang
sp. n.
A. Wing. B. Fore tibial scale. C. Superior volsella. D. Hypopygium, dorsal and ventral view.
TABLE 1. Lengths (in µm) and proportions of legs.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : male (BDN. 20688 ), CHINA , Fujian Province, Jianning County, the forestry bureau of county town,
26 . IX. 2002
; light trap, Z. Liu. Paratypes :
3 males
as the holotype ;
4 males
, Fujian Province, Yongtai County, the forestry bureau of county town,
17 . IX. 2002
; light trap, Z. Liu;
1 male
, Hainan Province, Lishui County, Diaoluo Town.
20 . V. 1988
, light trap, X. Wang.
Etymology. From Latin, absens , absent, and lobus , lobe, referring to the extremely reduced wing anal lobe.
Male imago (n= 5 ). Total length 1.36–1.85 , 1.60 mm . Wing length 0.86–1.05 , 0.94 mm . Total length/ wing length 1.45–1.97 , 1.70 . Wing length/ length of profemur 2.21–2.44 , 2.35 .

Coloration . Head brown with yellow palpomere. Thorax ground color yellowish brown with postnotum, epimeron II, hind anepisternum II and hind margin of preepisternum dark brown, halteres yellow. All femora brown with a pale middle ring; all tibiae with yellow basal part and brown apices; fore tarsus brown, mid and hind tarsi yellow. Abdominal segments entirely yellowish brown.

Head . AR 0.33–0.59 , 0.45 . Ultimate flagellomere 147–231, 179 µm long. Temporal setae 7 –8, 8, including 2 – 3, 2 inner verticals, 2 –3, 3 outer verticals and 2 –2, 2 postorbitals. Clypeus with 10 –11, 10 setae. Tentorium 68 –91, 80 µm long, 10 –13, 11 µm wide. Palpomere lengths (in µm): 18 –29, 22; 18 –26, 21; 44 –55, 51; 57 –70, 65; 94–114, 102 .
Thorax . Dorsocentrals 6 –10, 8; acrostichals 8 –10, 9; prealars 3 –4, 3. Scutellum with 2 –4, 3 setae.

Legs . Terminal scale (
Figure 1 B
) of front tibia 18 –26, 21 µm long, triangular and pointed apically. Spur of middle tibia 29 –31, 30 um long including 13 –18, 16 µm long comb, un-spurred comb 13 –18, 16 µm long, spur of hind tibia 34 –39, 36 µm long including 18 –23, 20 µm long comb, un-spurred comb 13 –26, 18 µm long. Width at apex of front tibia 29 –31, 30 µm, of middle tibia 26 –34, 30 µm, of hind tibia 31 –42, 35 µm. Lengths (in µm) and proportions of legs as in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. The differences between
P . ( T .) atroari
,

,

,

and

sp. n.
Typification of structures follows Bidawid & Fittkau (1995).

tr.th: Shape of anal Tergite IX Type B
Split setae on inferior volsella without

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. The species was collected from Oriental China .

Remarks. The new species is close to Neotropical species
P . ( T .) atroari
,
P . ( T .) carijona
,
P . ( T .) karyana
and
P . ( T .) kuikuro
described by
Bidawid & Fitttkau ( 1995 )
and
Bidawid-Kafka ( 1996 )
in have no wing marking and no projection on each side of the anal point. The morphological differences between them see table 2 .
